text: Richard Hunt (September 12, 1935 â€“ December 16, 2023) was an American sculptor. He was born in Chicago. His sculptures were metal abstract constructions. He studied at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago in the 1950s. In 1971, he was the first African-American sculptor to have a retrospective at Museum of Modern Art in New York. Hunt created more than 160 public sculptures in 24 states. == References == Category:1935 births Category:2023 deaths Category:American sculptors Category:Artists from Chicago
